title.text: Can Subcategorisation Probabilities Help a Statistical Parser?

abstractContent.text: Research into the automatic acquisition of lexical information from corpora is starting to produce large-scale computational lexicons containing data on the relative frequencies of sub-categorisation alternatives for individual verbal predicates.

entities.text: automatic acquisition of lexical information from corpora

abstractContent.text: However, the empirical question of whether this type of frequency information can in practice improve the accuracy of a statistical parser has not yet been answered.

In this paper we describe an experiment with a wide-coverage statistical grammar and parser for En-glish and subcategorisation frequencies acquired from ten million words of text which shows that this information can significantly improve parse accuracy 1 .

introductionContent.text: Recent work on the automatic acquisition of lexical information from substantial amounts of machine-readable text (e.g.) has opened up the possibility of producing largescale computational lexicons containing data on the relative frequencies of subcategorisation alternatives for individual verbal predicates.
